Method Detail

URIIntent

public static Intent URIIntent(Uri uri)
Builds an intent based on a uri. The resultant intent would be used to load an activity that supports the uri. Eg.. the webbrowser app will handle URLs passed as a uri.

Parameters:
uri - The uri to handle.
Returns:
The created intent.

shareIntent

public static Intent shareIntent(java.lang.String[] to,
                                 java.lang.String subject,
                                 java.lang.String body)
Build an intent that would be passed to Intent.createChooser(). This intent would typically be used to start the email app.

Parameters:
to - The email address of the recipient.
subject - The subject of the message.
body - The message.
Returns:
The created intent.

shareIntent

public static Intent shareIntent(java.lang.String[] to,
                                 java.lang.String subject,
                                 java.lang.String body,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<Uri> attachmentUris,
                                 java.lang.String attachmentMimeType)
Build an intent that would be passed to Intent.createChooser(). This intent would typically be used to start the email app.

Parameters:
to - The email address of the recipient.
subject - The subject of the message.
body - The message.
attachmentUris - Optional attachment files, null no attachments.
attachmentMimeType - Mime type of the attachments. (all the attachments should be the same mime type)
Returns:
The created intent.

isIntentActionAvailable

public static boolean isIntentActionAvailable(Context context,
                                              java.lang.String action)
Indicates whether the specified action can be used as an intent. This method queries the package manager for installed packages that can respond to an intent with the specified action. If no suitable package is found, this method returns false. Taken from: http://snipplr.com/view/15639/determine-if-intent-receiver-exists-in-android/ Modified to cache results.

Parameters:
context - The application's environment.
action - The Intent action to check for availability.
Returns:
True if an Intent with the specified action can be sent and responded to, false otherwise.
